testInfo.name: Gesamtfragenkatalog zum Test „Leben in Deutschland“ und zum „Einbürgerungstest“

questions.germanQuestion: Welches Wappen gehört zum Freistaat Thüringen?
questions.englishQuestion: Which coat of arms belongs to the Free State of Thuringia?
questions.notes: The coat of arms of the Free State of Thuringia is a symbol of the state's history and identity.
questions.learningTechniques: Focus on identifying the unique elements of the Thuringia coat of arms.

resources.description: Learn more about the coat of arms of Thuringia.

questions.germanQuestion: Welches ist ein Landkreis in Thüringen?
questions.englishQuestion: Which is a district (Landkreis) in Thuringia?
questions.notes: The 'Wartburgkreis' is a district located in the state of Thuringia.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the names of districts within Thuringia, especially 'Wartburgkreis.'

resources.description: Learn more about the districts in Thuringia.

questions.germanQuestion: Für wie viele Jahre wird der Landtag in Thüringen gewählt?
questions.englishQuestion: For how many years is the state parliament (Landtag) in Thuringia elected?
questions.notes: The state parliament in Thuringia is elected for a term of 5 years.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the term length for the Landtag in Thuringia is 5 years, which aligns with most other German federal states.

resources.description: Learn more about the political system in Thuringia.

questions.germanQuestion: Ab welchem Alter darf man in Thüringen bei Kommunalwahlen wählen?
questions.englishQuestion: At what age can you vote in local elections in Thuringia?
questions.notes: In Thuringia, citizens can participate in local elections starting at the age of 16.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that 16 is the voting age for local elections in Thuringia, allowing younger citizens to engage in their community's political process.

resources.description: Learn more about voting rights in Thuringia.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Farben hat die Landesflagge von Thüringen?
questions.englishQuestion: What are the colors of the state flag of Thuringia?
questions.notes: The state flag of Thuringia consists of the colors blue, white, and red.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember the blue, white, and red colors of Thuringia's flag, which reflect the state's identity.

resources.description: Learn more about the flag of Thuringia.

questions.germanQuestion: Wo können Sie sich in Thüringen über politische Themen informieren?
questions.englishQuestion: Where can you get information on political topics in Thuringia?

options.germanOption: bei der Landeszentrale für politische Bildung
options.englishOption: at the State Center for Civic Education

questions.notes: In Thuringia, the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' (State Center for Civic Education) is the key institution for learning about political topics.
questions.learningTechniques: Focus on the role of the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' in educating the public about political matters in Thuringia.

resources.description: Learn more about the State Center for Civic Education in Thuringia.

questions.englishQuestion: The state capital of Thuringia is called ...
questions.notes: The state capital of Thuringia is Erfurt, a city known for its well-preserved medieval city center and as a center for higher education.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that Erfurt is the capital of Thuringia, a city with significant historical and cultural importance.

resources.description: Learn more about Erfurt, the capital of Thuringia.

questions.notes: Thuringia is located in the central part of Germany and is one of the country's 16 federal states.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the geographical location of Thuringia on a map of Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about the geography of Thuringia.

questions.germanQuestion: Wie nennt man die Regierungschefin/den Regierungschef in Thüringen?
questions.englishQuestion: What is the title of the head of government in Thuringia?
questions.notes: The head of government in Thuringia is called the 'Ministerpräsidentin' or 'Ministerpräsident,' a title equivalent to 'Minister-President.'
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the title 'Ministerpräsident' is used for the heads of government in German federal states, including Thuringia.

resources.description: Learn more about the role of the Minister-President in Germany.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Ministerin/welchen Minister hat Thüringen nicht?
questions.englishQuestion: Which minister does Thuringia not have?
questions.notes: Thuringia, like other German federal states, does not have a Foreign Minister ('Außenminister'), as foreign affairs are handled at the federal level.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that federal states in Germany do not have foreign ministers, as foreign policy is the responsibility of the federal government.

resources.description: Learn more about the structure of state governments in Germany.
